issue.title: Add Python library build toolchain
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I will be working on a patch to make the initial Arrow C++ `libarrow.so` library callable from Cython (http://cython.org/) extensions. For the uninitiated, Cython is the modern "gold standard" for interoperability with C++ libraries. I have used it recently to create Kudu's Python client (https://github.com/apache/incubator-kudu/tree/master/python/kudu).

A significant amount of Python "glue code" will be needed to interoperate with pandas, NumPy, and other standard Python libraries (in addition to Python's built-in scalar data types), but these will be the subject of many follow up JIRAs.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7?focusedCommentId=15172190) by Maciej Bryński (maver1ck):*
Why not CFFI ?
https://cffi.readthedocs.org/en/latest/

In fact this is modern standard to communicate between Python and C.
CFFI has one big advantage over Cython. It works with PyPy.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7?focusedCommentId=15172266) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
"In fact this is modern standard to communicate between Python and C." – this is not true at all in the scientific Python / PyData ecosystem. As you will see when I get the patches put together, the extent of the low-level interoperability required to make this work well goes significantly beyond what is possible with CFFI. In particular, significant use of the Python and NumPy C APIs.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7?focusedCommentId=15172274) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Of course, you are more than welcome to contribute CFFI wrappers for libarrow for use in PyPy.
